basics.name: Michael Van Der Velden
basics.description: My name is Michael. I am a full stack javascript developer based in Liverpool. At age 16, I founded a limited company to sell a web based reward system to businesses. While that product is no longer accessible to the public, I used it as a jumping off platform to get my foot into the development world. After some time at an internship and a stint at a web development agency, I got a job at Puntt. I have been working at Puntt since partway through 2018 and have been responsible for updating and maintaining the core systems for day to day business. I'm a confident individual, who likes to keep my skills on the cutting edge, and a potential asset to any team.

highlights: Maintain the core systems of the Puntt product
Train up new staff members on the processes and standards followed within the Puntt codebase
Support the operations staff when issues were faced outside of standard work hours
Took part in regular "Clean Code" Sessions
Discussed Programing best practice with team members
Regularly met with the company founder to access skill progress
Build stateful web applications using Ember.JS
Work with clients to ensure Wordpress blogs met their design brief
Manage deadlines to ensure that client projects got out the door by given release dates
Research new technologies to ensure products were improved for clients were possible

keywords: I'm at ease speaking in front of large and small crowds alike
I can easily listen to a range of solutions and decide on a plan of approach
I can take criticism in my stride and use it to better myself
I can work in a team or alone depending on what the situation requires
skills.name: Soft Skills

projects.name: Puntt
projects.description: Puntt is the world's first licenced esports player betting site. Making use of Pool betting, I am responsible for maintaining the core backend systems of the Puntt Site. This includes the systems for running the betting pools as well as the systems for settlement based on external APIs. I trained up numerous new staff members to ensure they understood how the system worked as well as what was required for maintenance.

projects.name: Thanks
projects.description: Although the project is no longer up and running, Thanks was a gratitude based reward system for employees and students wherein helping your coworkers could be internally recognised and later rewarded. It was the primary product of my company, Vandie Studios Ltd.
